title.rendered: Print a Thing’s Community 3D Printing Network

content.rendered:
Print a Thing’s Community 3D Printing Network.

The 3D printing community is a close-nit family and word of mouth is everything. With that in mind, we were very excited when the folks at Fabbaloo wrote a nice piece on how easy it is to work with Print a Thing and how our network is very cost effective compared to the other options out there.

You can read the full piece at http://www.fabbaloo.com/blog/2015/5/3/print-a-things-community-3d-printing-network.

We strive to give our customers a high quality print that is cost effective along with a great experience and this article did a great job of showcasing our processing.

Many engineers out there currently print their own prototypes on their own printers. They do this to get quick feedback on the design. As they print the first design they have to go through their own trial and error process. They may ultimately need 100 of these parts, but after they have created the design that works best for them, it can be a daunting task to print the full batch themselves. And these professionals certainly have things they’d rather be doing.

That is where Print a Thing can help. If you have a design you need prints of and you want a trusted and proven network to handle the printing, we can help. Print a Thing’s network of trusted and proven printers will deliver your final product cost effectively and in time frame that meets your needs. And that’s worth writing about.
